text: 請您耐心看完塑膠帶來多長遠的問題，請大家少用塑膠吧！

自然的芋頭

 米塔颱風帶來的雨水，使得我們菜園中，已經成熟的芋頭水份太多，引來蟲子吃掉一些。

 星期五（10/4）我們六個人，把芋頭全部挖起來了，一共有十幾公斤。其中有一顆日本白芋，和一顆檳榔心芋特別大，他們加起來超過兩公斤重。

 市面上，比這樣大的芋頭太多太多了，但是生長在這個菜園內，除了澆水以外， 沒施予任何東西，長到這樣已經算很不錯了，它們的風味、囗感也都是很好的。

農夫老樂兒參訪自然農場記

 感謝機緣讓我能夠在彥均和福君兩位菩薩的指引下，遇見每一位善良、溫暖而健康的當地朋友。

 在台中那天，我留意到大家基本上，都是處在化學農業的包圍中，我們把這種情況，稱作孤島效應。

 
這次見到的農友，大多和我一樣，是半路出家的農民。令我回想起，剛到郷下耕種的時候，很多當地的農民，會用一種神秘而好奇的眼光看著我們。這些農民和他們的父祖輩，基本上，從1980年開始使用化肥、農藥，到現在已經三、四十年了，他們大都已經忘記不用化肥、農藥，該怎麼耕種，更別說去考慮化學物質帶來的自然條件的惡化。我們（不用肥與藥的新農）的到來，往往會遭到很多的質疑，我們只有不斷地堅定自己的信念，牢記自己的初心，才能通過不斷的努力，去改變他們的看法，進而用我們的行動，影響他們加入我們的行列，孤島效應也就自然解決。

 
之後，宜蘭的行程中，我也有感受到一個問題，好像沒有看到，在大家的田地中，有一部分是保證自給自足的，我想可能是台灣從事自然農法，或者有機農法的人比較多，大家可以比較方便地採買，或者交換到放心的食材吧？但我蠻好奇，大家是通過什麼辦法，來保證自己的食品安全呢？

 讓自己和家人吃放心的食物，然後分享給更多周邊的人，這是我最初的發心，您是不是也和我有同樣的初心呢？

 
今早跟彥均師姐講，這次回來後，我敢許願了，此刻我的心願是，在合適的機緣，打開我農場的大門，讓更多週圍還在從事慣型農業的人們，在我這裡分享到自然農法帶來的喜悅，從而影響更多人，加入心靈環保的行列，和我們一同提升人的品質，建設人間淨土。

深刻感受它的好處
李靜瑤

 我都是很早到田裡，在小木屋準備早餐吃。最近整理柳丁園，如果吃麵包加穀粉漿後，再到柳丁園除草，只能除一桶油，就要回木屋休息，不能再做了。

 有一次早餐忘記帶麵包，就帶著水、芭樂和火龍果到柳丁園去除草。除了一桶油後，喝水和吃水果，這次竟然能再除一桶油，身體並不感覺累。

 自然農法種植的水果當早餐，讓我的身體很輕安，可以除草四個小時，這時我才深刻感受這自然農法水果的好處！

得到博士學位後當農夫

 8/30中午，我們拜訪了宜蘭＂倆佰甲＂發起人楊文全先生。
農業中應興應革的事情太多，長期關懷城郷問題的楊先生常常問自己：我能做什麼呢？
楊先生希望整個蘭陽平原，全部是友善耕作的地方。但是他不能一下子，就把它轉變過來，於是在他50歲剛得到博士學位後，就在宜蘭員山一帶，先是自己當半農，然後幫助朋友也一起從事友善耕作。接著他成立＂倆佰甲＂，協助更多人圓農夫夢。
 
現在他57歲，在他的協助下，已經有一百五十人，在員山一帶加入友善耕作，操作面積巳有一百甲，他還幫忙代耕，並協助新農解決許多問題，諸如：找地、住宿、技術、人工⋯等等現實需求。

芋頭和空心菜都喜歡水，把它們種在隔壁，多澆些水，兩種都可以長得很好。

 芊揷於水中的空心菜，十多天即可採收，採後又再長，一株可以採四五次，弱勢後拔除再重種。

 現在我們的芋頭的葉片非常大，下雨時可以當傘用。種下200天左右，外葉枯黃到只剩下兩三片心葉時，芋頭塊根就長大，可以採收了。

為附近農友代耕的因緣
龔哲敬

 
我進入宜蘭縣員山鄉，學習自然農法之後，發現大多數從全台各地來此耕作的夥伴，由於缺乏大型機械，生產的主權，被慣行農業的代耕業者掌握，時常被棄之不顧，於是決定與幾位農友一起，建構服務友善耕作，自然農法的代耕體系。
我的組織命名為埊，這裡的山水土斱是我最熱愛的。

 我服務的除了水稻代耕，也協助新農進場、自家農產販售，並進行環境教育，以農為本，喚起大眾對台灣的關切。

以下是福和自然田，林振源先生，以農地的素材拼成的花來供佛，我認為：
以沒有使用過農藥的花草插花供佛，更清淨、莊嚴！而且可以把附近的景象帶入室內，比用外來的花材，更多了一份自然、合協、自在。而且不必花錢買， 比較經濟一點。
很值得推廣。

蝸牛自然變少了
王俊智

 原本我的菜園，菜很難種成功，連長到30多公分高的瓠瓜苗，也會被啃死。
更不用說撒下的菜籽，長出來的小苗了！

 不用藥，怎麼在＂牛口＂下為菜求出路呢？我採移民政策，將蝸牛移出。

 最近因為下雨，菜園常常土質濕潤，陸生渦蟲和山窗螢（一種螢火蟲）的幼蟲不少，牠們獵食非洲蝸牛，境外移入的大蝸牛，可能一一成了蟲兒們的餐點，而數量大減。

 現在撒下的菜籽，已經可以長大，有菜摘了。

 註：在台中大甲溪秘境田裡，
花嘴鴨、紅冠水雞、白腹秧雞、彩鷸⋯，甚至老鼠都有掠食福壽螺的狀況。

在台灣，柳丁等芸香花科果樹，很容易因天牛蛀而枯死，所以一般都要運用防治方法，又大多為了外型美觀，常使用美白手法。
福和沒用以上的手法，柳丁能長這麼好，很讃嘆！

text:
結業式

 今天學期結束，大家品嚐一下自己種的玉米，跟外面買的有什麼不同。世事無常，不知以後我們還能不能種出這麼好的玉米？
也採收一些適合採的果菜，每個人拿一點回去，跟家人分享。

 Today the semester is completed we tasted our own corns and picked some crops
from the garden to share with the family of each student.

昨天(6月28日)在苗栗南庒山上，一處農場中，看到很多很久沒有見到的琉璃鳳蝶，感到很歡喜。

 農地也是野生動物的棲息，我們以友善衆生的方式農耕，盡量不去傷害野生的小動物，牠們也會替人類帶來，無法估算的利益。

 Yesterday (June 28）when I was staying at a friend’s farm I noticed that there
were a lot of butterflies around the farm. They made me feel good.

 Farming land at the same time is also the home of wild lives. When we treat
them nicely they will benefit us incredibly.

自己跌倒自己爬起來

 在菜園中種玉米，最好種在挖低的溝裡，再把土培高，植株比較不會被風吹倒。

 萬一被風吹倒了，為了避免傷玉米的根，通常我是讓它們自己爬起來，而不是去扶正它們，最近也是這樣。

 Getting up by themselves 

 It is better to plant corn onto a low place to avoid them from falling down by
bad weather.

 Once they fall down unfortunately I usually let them stand up all by themselves
instead of pushing them by manpower to avoid hurting their roots.

第一顆甜桃

 去年冬天冷的日子不多，台灣許多地方，桃李櫻梅等花開少了，果實也就更少。

 然而，北投泉源國小附近，張家兄妹的園子，這一期梅子卻長得特別多。我菜園有一棵甜桃，今年結果的情況，跟去年類似。

 4月19日我採了第一顆成熟的甜桃。

 There weren’t many cold days during last winter in Taiwan. Countless prune,
peach and cherry trees didn’t bloom well thus causing a shortage of such fruits
all around the island.

 However my friend’s prune tree bore quite a bit more fruits compared to
previous years.
And my peach tree is just as good as last year.

 On April nineteenth I picked the first peach from my own peach tree.

A菜和玉米的短暫相遇
果祥法師

 冬末種的A菜，春天時在它們旁邊，埋下玉米種子。

 當兩種作物都長得蠻大時，A菜已經可以採收了，剩下的空間留給玉米，也沒有誰會搶走玉米的陽光。

 小面積栽培，這樣種更充分利用土地。

 When spring comes, the corn seeds are buried next to the Taiwanese lettuce
planted at the end of winter.

 When two crops grow pretty big, the Taiwanese lettuce is already for harvest.
The remaining space is for the corn to stretch randomly, and no others will take
away its sunshine.

 By farming in a small area, the land will be more fully used this way.

探望年輕農友

 我們一行人今天下午去宜蘭，探視因手受傷，療養中的年輕農友龔哲敬，他看起來似乎還蠻樂觀的。
今天聽龑先生説，今年他的花生大豐收，一棵花生都長35夾左右，一夾有二至四粒，而且蟲螞吃得很少，比一般看到的還要好，而他既沒施肥，也沒做生物防治。
他非常重視自己留種，這花生自留種，已經是第三年了。

拜訪林哲安

 昨天上午，我們第一次去宜蘭新南，拜訪林哲安和阿農伯父子。
了解到二十七歲的林哲安，對於鳥類和其他動物，包括昆蟲等的愛護，從小就與他的靈魂合而為一，他種稻的目的是，營造生物棲地，保育鳥類和其他生物。如今和他協作的夥伴，有阿農伯父子，和官老爺等7位農民，稻作面積有7.5公頃。
他自己的稻田有7分地，他一年只施一次米糠，一半的目的是，供養鳥類和其他生物來吃食，然後留下新陳代謝的產物，替稻田施肥，一半才是以米糠的養份肥沃土壤。
雖然他並不很在乎農作的收成，然而他的收穫，還是蠻不錯的。（他説比一般好。）
哲安在田裡裝設氣候觀查器，也每年詳細計錄、追踪鳥類利用這片田地的狀況，非常細心地，在田裡作生態保育的工作。真是一位天使青農，或者可說是位農夫菩薩。

這是＂法鼓山在十月二六、二七的研討會＂心靈環保農業創生＂的報名網址 
https://www.ddm.org.tw/mobile/news_in.aspx?modid=6&nid=8209

自己長的絲瓜苗
李靜瑤

 自然成熟掉落的絲瓜，種子長得到處都是，今天除草看到這畫面，感覺自然的力量真偉大，絲瓜苗長得好漂亮好健康。

 我現在每年都不用種絲瓜，它們都是自己長出來，我只要理好它的藤，就會有吃不完的絲瓜，真是好吃又好玩！

 There are lots of the seedlings of the squashes that matured on the plants and
spread seeds all around the garden naturally. When I was weeding this morning I
saw these beautiful seedlings. They tell us the power of nature by showing their
lovely figures.

 During recent years I have always had squashes grown by themselves in the farm.
As long as I take care of the vines of the squashes I would have a lot of
squashes. Adding more fun besides the delicious flavor that the squashes
provide.

許多葉菜的花都可以吃，而且比葉子還要美味，例如：
芥蘭花、油菜花、蘿蔔花、芥菜花、芹菜花、白菜花⋯等等，折下之後還會再長，一株往往可以採很多次花。

 The flowers of many leafy vegetables are edible and even more tasty than the
leaves.
Recently I harvested many of the vegetable flowers from my Beitou garden.

四月二十一日，我和常法法師帶著自然農法班的學員，參訪南澳張明麗老師的水月農場，大家還幇忙下田補秧。
如今收割的黑米已成熟入庫，看到這些以愛心耕耘，無農藥、無肥料的黑米，回想當時參訪的情景，內心有著無數的感動。

奇怪的瓜果

 昨天（6/9）我在台中看到一個停車場，旁邊有兩棵高大的芒果樹，上面結實纍纍。尤其是，其中一棵芒果長得像荔枝或葡萄，實在太奇怪了。

 
我的外甥女婿（他是農夫)說：蔬果長成這樣，是今年才看到的現象，以前從沒見過。台東有農友，今年小黃瓜也是異常，大的旁邊又長小的，而蓮霧則是有的在套袋，有的在採收，還有許多花在開。
雲林的農友也是，第一次看到大鳳梨旁邊，長出好幾顆小鳳梨。

 不知來年情況會怎樣，現象異常，我總覺得不太安心！

 Strange Fruits

 Yesterday, beside a parking lot in Taichung, I ran into two giant mango trees
which were laden with many fruits. However, on one of the trees in particular,
it is quite abnormal to see the mangoes growing as if the lichees or the grapes.

 According to my niece's husband, who is also a farmer, the fruits and
vegetables have never been growing like this until this year.Some other farmers
from other places also observed the similar deviance, whereas wax apples
gherkins and pineapple were grown quite unusual.

 I am wondering what it would be happening in the future years. I don't feel at
ease upon such abnormality.

休耕兩年後的菜園角落，
由於過去割下來的草，常往這裡堆，這一季這裡種的玉米和山藥，似乎比其他地點種的健壯些。

 This corner of my Beitou farm have lied fallow for two years. 
In this season, the corn and dioscorea that we planted at this corner look very
strong as we have disposed of lots of weeds and grass here over the period of
two years.

今年秋冬季，我北投菜園的大梅花蘿蔔長得不錯，沒有施肥、也沒有放酵素或其他東西，才68天就蠻大了。

 The condition of the radish in my Beitou farm in this season looks fine. They
have big size when it is the 68 day after planting seeds.

迷你南瓜

 這顆南瓜的母親是南瓜，父親是絲瓜。

 母花開那天，相臨的兩棵南瓜植株，和附近的田裡，都沒有南瓜公花開放。幸好相距三、四公尺遠，有一株絲瓜，開了兩朵公花，就是這樣，使得這朵母南瓜花授粉成功。

 然而，因為授粉不完全，所以它的個子特別小，像顆玩具南瓜。不過，在我心裡非常感謝，能有這異種瓜雜交帶來的果實。

參觀隔壁菜園
果祥法師

 四月十四日，我帶了台中來的果雲法師，和二十位居士，參觀隔壁，謝原鳴、陳敏玲伉儷的菜園。

 他們的熱情招待，讓客人感受到自然農法，不僅對大地、對農作物有善，對人更是友善。

 Visiting neighboring farm 
Guo Hsiang fa-Shi

 On April 14th I accompanied Guo yun fa-shi and 20 lay Buddhists come from
Taichung visited the neighboring farm owned by Mr. Shei and his wife. 

 Their hospitality made the guests thought that natural farming is not only
environmental-friendly but also extremely people-friendly.

這一塊地
果祥法師

 這一塊地，在我之前的租戶
抱怨說：「土層很薄，挖下去很快就並到岩石，種什麼都沒有收穫。」這對夫妻租了三年後放棄了。

 兩年前，我租下後發現，那不是岩石而是硬土。去年秋天，挖鬆以後，放入枯葉，和少量的草，秋冬作物長得不錯。最近一個多月以來，陸續種下的玉米，也似乎都健康正常。

 The Land

 By Guo Hsiang Fa-Shi

 This land, before I rented it, its owner complained, “The rock bed is very high
and very hard to grow crops. I have harvested nothing.”

 Two years ago, I rented it and found out no rocks but hard soil. I dug it

text:
花香玉米

 聽到台中大肚山學會吳金樹老師帶領的團隊，在大肚山上，以友善耕種種的花生，今天邁入第六年，這一期的花生帶著花香，令我又好奇、又羨慕。

 沒想到，我最近採到的玉米，也帶著花香，令我非常意外、驚喜！這玉米的種子，來自於宜蘭阿聰自然田，代代以自然農法耕種，自留的種子。

 然而，如果我施肥、用藥，這花香還會存在嗎？就不知道了。

很多人以為地瓜葉沒有蟲，其實不然，我也常看到地瓜葉被蟲吃得蠻厲害的，甚至於吃得面目全非，看不出是地瓜葉。
林先生的地瓜葉為什麼沒有蟲洞，這裡有説明原因。
以下是高雄有機小農的心聲，也是我嚴重關切的問題，影響我們很大！

哇，今天的米粉怎麼這麼好吃呢？
那是自然農法種的米做的啊！

 Vow!The rice noodle is really delicious！
Yes，it is made of the rice grown by natural farming method.

楊安和的有機蜜棗園
果祥法師

 三月十一日，我們參訪楊安和先生的有機蜜棗園，看到他用打碎的樹木枝葉，摻了碳化稻殼，放置三年後才當堆肥。

 
他說他自己和馬清宮先生，都施這種堆肥。馬先生有拿土壤去檢驗，過去他的果園，鉀肥和磷肥不夠，施放了好多次鉀粉和磷粉，卻沒有改善，後來放這種堆肥，鉀肥和磷肥竟成長了四倍。馬清宮的目標是，有機質達到5時，就停用外來資材。他認為當土壤生態已能自主自給時，外來的資材不一定是加分的。

 
楊安和先生又說，土壤養分的平衡很重要。以他的經驗看到，如果鉀肥太多，就會出現白蚊，如果生態不健全，又養份不平衡，就會長蚜蟲，但這二點，他還沒長期認真做實驗，不敢説是定論。

 
又，以他的經驗，如果氮肥欠缺5%，卻補充了10%，就會出現捲心蟲，補充了15%，就會出現很多捲葉蟲，連續三年所見皆如此，原因就是施了過多氮肥，造成土壤養分不平衡。

 棗樹在缺水的情況下，也會出現一種危害果實蒂頭的捲心蟲，和銀葉粉蝨，補充水份就能改善。

 目前，楊安和 在果園內種菜不施肥，但棗園內有放幫助樹葉生長的肥料，這種肥使得草長得很好，草又幫助了果樹的生長。

 註1、他們用的樹枝，是向專門收購樹枝的公司買的，打碎後再賣給農民。

 註2、楊安和表示，他放碳化稻殼，是因為稻殼燒焦後，很多東西不見了，而留下很多的鉀和磷，對於樹根的生長有幫助，能使果樹健壯。

 註3、馬清宮表示，樹葉、樹枝和碳化稻殼，是活化土壤最好的資材，它能讓土壤的微生物，產生有效磷肥、鉀肥，及各種植物所需要的養份。

 Mr. Yang, An-He’s Organic Jujube Orchard
By Guo Hsiang Fa-shi

 On March 11th, we visited Mr. An-He Yang’s organic jujube orchard, watching him
use the broken branches and leaves to mix with carbonized rice husks, place them
for three years, and later fertilize, as compost, his orchard.

 Mr. Yang said that both Mr. Ching-Gong Ma’s garden and his orchard were spread
this kind of compost. Mr. Ma took the soil for examination. In the past, the
soil of his orchard was lacking of potassic fertilizer and phosphate fertilizer.
After he spread potassium powder and phosphorus powder for several times, the
soil quality was still not improved. With this compost, however, the potassic
fertilizer and phosphate fertilizer in the soil grew as much as four times! The
goal of Mr. Ma ,Ching-Gong is to stop using exotic materials when the soil
organic matter becomes five. He thinks when the soil ecosystem becomes
self-sufficient, exotic materials may not benefit the soil.

 Further, Mr. Yang, An-He emphasized the balance among the soil nutrients was
important. From his experiences, for instance, if the soil contained too much
potassic fertilizer, aedes albolineatus would appear. If the ecosystem was not
sound and healthy, and the nutrients were not balanced, aphids would grow.
However, not having seriously experimented yet, he could not conclude his
experiences.

 Again, from his experience, if the soil lacked of nitrogenous fertilizer for
five percent but added it to ten percent, tea leaf rollers would show up. If
fifteen percent of nitrogenous fertilizer was added, lots of leaf rollers would
come out. It happened continually for three years as he observed. It was because
putting too much nitrogenous fertilizer made the soil nutrients out of balance.

 In the condition of lacking water, on jujube trees, tea leaf rollers and silver
leaf whiteflies would appear, harming the fruit pedicles. The condition would be
improved after water was supplied.

 Currently Mr. Yang, An-He grows vegetables without fertilizers in his orchard.
On his jujube orchard, however, the fertilizer helping the tree leaves grow is
spread. This kind of fertilizer makes the grass grow very well, and the grass
helps the tree grow.

 Note 1: Branches are bought from the company mainly collecting branches,
shattering them, and then selling to farmers.

 Note 2: Mr. Yang, An-He expressed that the reason he put carbonized rice husks
was because many things disappeared after the rice husks were burned, but
remained a lot of potassium and phosphorus, helping the roots grow and
strengthening the trees.

 Note 3: Mr. Ma, Ching-Gong states that leaves, branches, and carbonized rice
husks are the best materials for activating the soil. They provide microbes in
the soil to produce effective phosphate fertilizer, potassic fertilizer, and
nutrients needed for various kinds of plants.

以下是福和自然田，主人林振源先生剛剛採下，準備寄出的菜。

 
他們的田已經有六年不施肥了（包括化肥、有機肥、豆渣、酵素⋯等），只是前半年用了相當多的落葉，後來大部分是靠自己田裡的廢棄藤、莖、枯葉、雜草⋯，但是果菜都長得蠻大的，秘訣之一是：成片的犁底層破了。

 農場只有600坪，出產五十幾種作物。

text:
漂亮的青花筍
果祥法師

 前天採了不少青花筍，
送出四分之三，我自己留了三小顆，煮了一次之後，才想到應該留影記念。

 這次種的青花菜，跟青花筍都沒有被蟲吃，非常地漂亮、完美。

 以我過去的經驗，十字花科蔬菜，到了春天以後，蟲會越來越多，現在已經是二月下旬了，青花筍卻如此完整，我想應該也與種植過程中，完全沒有施肥有關。

 Broccolini 
by Guo Hsiang fa-shi

 The day before yesterday, a lot of broccolini were harvested, so I left some of
them enough for breakfast at Dharma Drum Mountain Chung-Hwa Institute of
Buddhist Culture. Three smaller ones were kept for meself. After cooking, it
came to my mind that a picture should be taken for memories.

 This time the broccolini had no insect bite, growing beautifully and perfectly
well. From my previous experiences, cruciferous vegetables got more and more
worms or pests during spring; however, these spouting broccolis were very good.

 Note: In the process of planting, I completely spread no fertilizers, used no
phobotaxis creatures, but watered only.

自然農法的薑黃
李靜瑤

 我的薑黃每年採收時，都會留一塊在原來的地方，不去動它，明年會再長薑黃，這是最輕鬆的耕種方式。
今年的薑黃特別地香，切ㄧ薄片含在嘴裏，香氣十足，有一股溫暖的氣息，輕柔地流動著。
今天來了幾位朋友，他們聞到薑黃的葉子的香味，就跟我要這些已經枯萎的葉子帶回家，因為這個香氣太動人了，他們捨不得丟掉。

 這就是好幾代自留種，加上八年自然農法的田，產出的好食物的風味！

 Curcuma by Natural Farming
By Ching-Yao Li

 When harvesting my curcuma every year, I will leave a remaining strain on the
land, not pulling it out; therefore it will continually grow curcuma next year.
It is the most relaxing farming.

 This year the curcuma spreads special scent. Slice it thinly, put one in my
mouth, smell its rich flavor, and then I feel that a current of warm air
tenderly flows in my body.

 A few friends stopped by today. After smelling the fragrance of the curcuma
leaves, they asked me if they could bring these withered leaves home. Due to the
attractive scent, they just would not throw them away.

 It is the reason that I keep the remaining strains for generations, plus the
field with eight-year farming, to produce the flavor of good quality food.

野莧鹼稯

 五月十六日，我在台東鹿野，看到有一塊農地，上面長滿了野莧（鳥莧和刺莧），主人告訴我們，這些野莧是為了端午節留的。

 他們把野莧整株採下，曬乾後，以柴火熬煮4小時後，用它的鹼水加工，做成鹼糭，而不是用一般，常用的化學鹼粉。

 以前，他們也用稻草燒成灰燼，再煮水取用，但是顏色偏深，味道也重，後來就不再用了。

 這次參訪令我非常感動，還有農夫願意如此用心，照顧消費者的健康。身為消費者的我們大家，不知是否關心農業和農夫？

 Alkaline Water made by Green Amaranth

 On May 16, I visited LuYe (鹿野) in Taitung, where I saw a farmland were full of
Green Amaranth (野莧). According to the landlord, all of these are saved for the
use of the upcoming Dragon-Boat Festival. 

 They sun-dried the Green Amaranth, then had as long as 4 hours of boiling with
firewood. They chose to make Kee Chang (Red Bean Rice Dumpling) with Alkaline
Water derived from boiling water of the Green Amaranth, rather than using the
prevalent chemical baking soda. 

 They used to obtain boiling Alkaline water from the burned ash of straws.
Nevertheless, they gave up the method due to its dark color, and strong taste. 

 I was highly touched from this farmland visit. We could still find some farmers
who care health conditions of the consumers with so much delicate sincerity. As
consumers, we should care more of farmers and agriculture in return.

這些蟲會抑制蟲嗎？

 玉米開花時，許多平常看不到的昆蟲都出現了，最近也不例外。只是，大自然的豐富，遠超平我們的想像，以前較多的，今年不一定看到，今年出現的，明年也不一定會再來。

 這些蟲，很多都是農業中所謂的＂害蟲＂，但是，許許多多不同種類的害蟲會聚，會不會互相拔河？無數的拔河之後，最後受益的是誰呢？

 Could these insects hold the others in? 

 When the corn plant bloom, many rare insects also arrive during this period of
time, so as in recent days. 
The richness in nature is far beyond our imagination. Those appeared frequently
in the past may not turn up this year, whereas those visit this year may not
come again next year.

 Many of these insects are so-called pests in terms of agricultural practices.
However, would the assemblies of various species of pests contend against one
another? Who would be the final winner after all these numerous combats?

人面天蛾

 我當了六年的農夫，今天（5/21）第一次在自己的菜園，看到這樣大的毛毛蟲，原來牠是人面天蛾（又稱為鬼臉天蛾)的幼蟲。

 牠們喜歡茄子和蕃茄，今天這個貴客，把我們一棵茄子的嫩芽和葉子，全部吃光了。

 不過沒有關係，這種天蛾很少見，菜園能出現一隻幼蟲，我蠻歡喜的。

 I have committed to a farmer for six years. Today, May 21, it was the very
first time seeing such a big caterpillar from my own farmland, which is actually
a larva of so-called Acherontia lachesis. 

 This special "VIP guest", who loved to eat eggplants and tomato, has eaten all
of the sprouts and leaves from an eggplant tree. 

 Nevertheless, I am quite happy to meet such rare species of Acherontia lachesis
larva showing up in my farmland.

如果知道，這只勞力士錶是贗品，有人願意拿比真品更多的錢去買它嗎？

 可是，為什麼有那麼多人，願意拿更多的錢，去買以LED燈，取代太陽光；以人工調製的液體取代土壤，種出來的假蔬果呢？

 而且，那不是身體外邊用的，是拿來吃進肚子裡的！

 If you know this Rolex watch is fake, will you pay a high price to buy it?
Probably not.

 Yet, there are people who are willing to pay high price to buy fake vegetables
grown using LED instead of sunlight, artificial nutrient solution instead of
soil, and consume them as food!

昨天（1/7）法鼓山社會大學聯合結業典禮，在新莊農會及新荘社大教室舉行。我應邀在下午做了一場＂心靈環保自然農法＂講座。曾濟群校長，百忙中特別趕來致詞，並且全程參與講座。

 我和農法班學員，帶了很多我們自己種的蔬菜和水果，在演講會場展示。結束後，我們把帶來的蔬果，分送給所有的聽眾。

 雖然每個人得到的不多，但是平常不容易得到這麼好的自然農法蔬果，因此大家看來都很開心。

 Yesterday, the closing ceremony of Dharma Drum Mountain Social University
Autumn semester of year 2017 was conducted in Shinzuang.

 I was invited to give a talk on the “Spiritual Environmental Protection Farming
Method.”The Dean, Mr. Tseng Ji Chun, gave a welcoming speech.

 My students and I brought a lot of fruits and vegetables to the lecture hall
for exhibition. After my talk I shared all the farming products with everyone
who attended the lecture.

 Although each person only received a little gift, they seemed quite happy.

今夜，隔壁菜園的謝原鳴先生夫妻，晚上很晚才回家。因為他們發現許多中國樹蟾在夜間活動，整個五六百坪的菜園，大概有兩百隻中國樹蟾。

 生態恢復了很多，讓他們非常開心，感到自己對土地與小生命的愛護有了回報。

 Tonight the owners of my neighboring farm, Mr. and Mrs. Xei went home very
late. Because they found out that there were a lot of green Chinese tree fog
appeared in their farm. The total should be about 200 of them they said.

 Tt means that the wild lives are regenerating in their farm. They are so glad
of it.

昨天（9月30日）我們這一期羅東的心靈環保自然農法班，第二次實作。

 一位同學帶了很多點心來慰勞大家，有：堅果混合黑芝麻打的漿、葡萄堅果麵包和有機鳳梨。

 我帶了自然農法產品：火龍果2顆、奇異果1顆、香蕉1條。不要怪我吝嗇，迷你奇異果只帶一顆，因為就只有那麼一顆。

 我們不必像人家一次一個人吃一顆奇異果。聖嚴師父說那樣吃就像：豬八戒吃人參果！（不知道東西的珍貴）小小奇異果切成十一片，一人嚐一點，那滋味將永生難忘吧？

 Yesterday(30,Sep.) we worked at our natural farm in Loudon for the 2nd time in
this semester.

 A lady brought along with her many foods, including bread, juice and pineapple.
And I brought 3 kinds of fruits which were all grown by natural farming . They
are 2 dragon fruits, 1 kiwi fruit and 1 bananas. 
I cut the kiwi fruit into 11 little 
rings to let everyone had a taste to know the difference between a common kiwi
and a kiwi which is grown naturally.

 We don’t have to eat a whole kiwi to know the quality of the fruit. Once a
person has a little taste of an wonderful food he (she) would remember that
amazing experience all the time through his (her) life.

綁起來的草莓
果祥法師

 我們4/7在幸福農莊聽到酒井賢治先生說：草莓的莖綁在一起，讓葉子站起來，它會長得比較好，有種草莓的人不妨試試看。了解其中原理的朋友，敬請不吝指教。

 When I visited Happy farm on the seventh of April I heard 酒井賢治Sensei said if
you tie up the stems of the straw berry it will be more healthy and bearing more
fruits.

自留種韭菜
李靜瑤

 幾年前，我種茄子時，跟朋友要了幾株韭菜，做為共伴作物。韭菜剛開始長得並不好，當時我想：反正只是共伴作物，又不吃，也就沒再注意它。

 後來應該是，每年都有再長出新的韭菜來，今年也不例外，我看到韭菜長出來了，而且長得叫人另眼相看！
它的植株高大，葉片肥厚，型態漂亮，看起來很健康，生命力很旺盛。

 我那被忽略的韭菜，正好驗證了自留種的重要性！

 The Seedling-Reserved Leeks
By Li, Ching-Yao

 Several years ago, when I grew eggplants I asked a friend for a few leeks as
the companions. The leeks did not grow very well in the beginning. At that time,
I thought they were companions only, I would not eat them, so I did not take
care of them and almost forgot about them completely. 

 Later on, new leeks should have grown repeatedly every year. This year they
grow again with no exception. I observe the leeks grow up and impress everyone.
Their stalks are tall, leaves are thick, and the shapes are beautiful. They look
very healthy and are full of vitality.

 The leeks ignored by me just prove the importance of reserving seeds ( and
seedlings)for planting.

花生成熟了

 
今年夏天，我的菜園苦瓜長得最好，已經採了20多條了。其次是花生，今年長得比過去幾年好，現在採被蟲螞吃的不多，今天採了一半，明天下午，我要再去全部採收，以免放久了會採不到，因為蟲蟻動作很快！(註）

 註：這些四月中旬和玉米種在一起的，已成熟。五月中旬種的，還要再一個月才成熟。

 Peanuts are matured

 Today I picked half of the peanuts at my Beitou garden. Tomorrow I will be
picking all the rest peanuts. If I postpone the harvest for too much time the
ants and worms underneath the soil will eat them up.

生態豐富
果祥法師

 
今天（11月8日）我在北投菜園的仙草花上面，看到一隻在陽光下，閃閃發亮的藍緑色小昆蟲，（已知牠是大緑青蜂）我好奇地拿出手機拍攝之後，進一步發現還有許多的小昆蟲，都在那裡飛舞。

 我拍到了一些比較大型而不太怕人的昆蟲，發現牠們大多數是蜂和螢之類。

 所謂的生態豐富，我們的農地在田間作物開花時，最容易譲人感受到。

 November 8th, 2018

 Today on a Chinese mesona (Platostoma palustre) flower in the Beitou vegetable
farm, under the sunlight, I had discovered a small shining blue insect. Out of
curiosity, I took out my mobile phone and took a picture of it. Upon close
examination, it was found that there were even more small insects flying around.

 I was able to capture pictures of insects which were relatively large in size
and seemed to be indifferent with human presence. Those insects were mostly bees
and flies. 

 During the flowering season, when a crop field which is not disturbed by the
likes of insecticides and pesticides, we could most literally feel the presence
of biodiversity.

近幾年，看到有的人的菜園，雖然很小，卻種了很多不同的作物。有些人把喜愛的花卉，也種上小小的菜畦，看起來相當豐富、熱鬧。

 也有人認真在推廣菜園花園化，或是可食地景。我倒想到，如果想吸引非農夫，或小朋友來農地走走，設計美麗的菜園，是個好辦法。

 其實，相同的植物，靠得太近，可能長不好。不同的植物，需要的營養成分不同，靠得近比較沒問題。
早一點成熟的作物，收成後空出的空間，讓給旁邊較晚成熟的作物，如此應用小面積農園，更具效益。

 再則，蟲不愛吃的植物，散發的味道，能夠發揮忌避蟲子的效果，靠近蟲愛吃的作物，有保護對方的效用。

 又，許多不同的作物混種，共生共存共容，可以吸引更多元的土壤微生物及生物，牠們能夠幫助農作物得到更多的營養成分，人也會從中得到更多營養，並且食物也更具風味。

 今年我的菜園，也多了這樣的嘗試。

 In the last few years, I've visited quite a few vegetable farms. Some of them,
though small, managed to grow a huge variety of crops at the same time. 

 Some farmers even grow their favorite flowers on those small vegetable beds,
adding a very lively and vigorous atmosphere to their farms.

 In fact, if crops of the same kind are planted too close to one another, they
may not grow so well. On the other hand, different crops could be planted
closely without much problem because their demands of nutrients from the soil
are different. 

 In addition, some plants give out odors that could repel certain kinds of
insect. If planted close by, vegetables could also be protected. 

 If farmers plant various kinds of crops together, creating a prosperous
co-existing environment, more microbes and organisms would be attracted, giving
the crops a even richer flavor. 

 What's more important, the more organisms are involved, the more nutritious the
crops would be. 
Some crops have a shorter growth period. Once they are harvested, there would be
more space for those who are still growing. 

 This way, farm land could be cultivated in a more efficient way. What's more,
the various shapes and colors of all the crops present also make the garden a
pleasant, joyful and vigorous scene. 

 This year, experiments like these could also be found in my garden.

 The following is quoted from an article (published on 8 Dec) of Cai Jia Shan, a
reporter of News Market:

 After a lecture on soil physics, chemistry and biology, soil biologist Dr. Wang
Qiao Ping said: "Give your soil life a chance, and it will fix carbon, fix
nitrogen, loosen your soil, form soil aggregates, aerate your soil, improve soil
permeability, keep soil moisture, retain nutrients ... So why don't you give
your soil life a chance?"

 Actually, a natural farm should perform many ecological functions like forests
do, such as carbon sequestration, production of oxygen, etc.

 According to Wang Qiao Ping a friendly environment or an ecology field is not
just about abandoning the use of any agrochemical fertilizer, nor is it only
about having water birds flying around the farmland. It is being truly concerned
about the whole ecological system which includes living and non-living things.

 Based on the theory of dependent origination in Buddhism, everything is
interconnected. Every living and non-living thing in the natural environment are
closely related to everyone of us. This is precisely as mentioned in the
Avatamsaka Sutra: All in One, One in All.

小農夫

 五月十一日(周六）有一些故事花園班的小朋友，在法師、老師和家長的陪伴下，到農地實際體驗親近土地和種菜的滋味，小小年紀就有機會親自挖土、種菜，真是幸福。

 他們長大以後，可能還想種菜，也更會感謝菜生長的大自然，和種菜給自己吃的人吧？

 Little Farmers

 On Saturday, May 11th, 2019, accompanied by Venerable Guo Hsiang, teachers, and
their parents, the pupils of DDM Lan Yang Branch Monastery Story Garden Class
actually experienced the vegetable growing in the field, and became closer to
the land. They could dig into the earth and grow vegetables on their own at
their young ages. How lucky they were!

 When they grow up, will they probably still want to grow vegetables by
themselves, be thankful to the Nature nurturing the vegetables, and appreciate
the people growing vegetables for them?

鄧洪斌在新加坡聯合早報的訪談
全版 （pdf 檔）: https://1drv.ms/b/s!Al-FoymOC9RaiSQCsFfVGGLqVdRz
新加坡政府在國際舞台善用“中間人”的智慧，協助各國達成氣候行動共識﹔本地社群則積極實踐民間智慧，從個人做起，發揮群眾力量為氣候變化帶來一絲轉機。
“城市農夫”鄧洪斌（63歲，退休者）堅信通過自然農作法，把碳“鎖”在土壤中，以此減少空氣中的二氧化碳含量。
鄧洪斌目前在本地首個農耕義工團體“聚友愛”（Ground-Up Initiative），位於義順卡迪地鐵站附近羅弄真查魯（Lorong
Chencharu）的園地裡耕種。他日前帶記者參觀，所負責的農地，並介紹說，只要泥土逐步變成黑色，就能証明當中已封存了碳。
鄧洪斌說：“這其實是腐殖質（humus）在發揮作用。它的形成過程復雜，植物吸收陽光，利用空氣中的二氧化碳和水分，經過光合作用，制造碳水化合物，再經過植物和土壤微生物，產生的一系列反應後，產生泥土腐殖質。這也被視為一種碳封存的過程。”
腐殖質能讓植物生長得更好，但這類黑土不能裸露，也不能使用化學肥料。如果耕種得當，普通泥土一般需約三四年就能達到“鎖碳”目的，變為黑土。
鄧洪斌認為，政府通過減排對抗氣候變化的同時，本地若能發起更多農耕活動，加大碳封存量，不失為另一種解決方案。
對於這樣的堅持，他直言，“不樂觀，但還是要做”。
鄧洪斌近期也受邀，到一所中學進行義務指導，協助校方設立菜園。他希望能借此，把這類碳封存的做法，傳授給年輕學子，讓自然農作的環保理念生生不息。
非營利組織聚友愛設有手作、農耕和教育三大部門，主要推廣園藝和農耕活動。
聚友愛成立10年來，受到不少公眾推崇，吸引了不少同道中人參與活動。全職志願者協調員邱卉穎（28歲）認為，農耕活動能讓人，最直觀地體會到氣候的轉變。
她說：“近年來我們開始有點抓不准氣候變化的規律，蔬果的生長周期被打亂了。就好像每年12月新加坡是雨季，去年年底卻是炎熱乾旱天。”
邱卉穎也認為，氣候變化的威脅，其實離我們不遠，並會直接影響我們的生活。如果人們把應對氣候變化的挑戰視為己任，就能發揮群體力量，來應對必要的改變。
“接下來，我們希望通過有趣的活動，來傳達這一信息，吸引更多不太關注環保課題的公眾，一起加入愛護環境，和地球的行列。”
English translation by Lim Sixian
On the regional and international front, the Singapore government has taken
steps to serve as an advocate and a convenor for climate change action. Civic
society and community groups have also taken the initiative to take personal
responsibility and draw from the wisdom of community as a response to turning
the tide on climate change.
For Mr Tang Hang Bun (63,retiree), an urban farmer, he turns to natural farming
as a means of carbon sequestration - the process of effectively drawing carbon
from the air, back into our soil. Currently, Mr Tang farms at Ground-up
initiative, a non-profit community in Singapore, based at Lorong Chencharu, a
short walk away from Khatib MRT station. Showing the reporter around and
introducing the natural farming plot he tends to, Mr Tang shared that as one
cultivates the land, the gradual darkening of the soil over time is an
indication and a reflection of the carbon that is being drawn back into the
earth, captured in the soil. 
The ability of the soil to serve as a carbon sink is due to the presence of
humus, a stable soil organic matter. Mr Tang goes on to share about humus
formation, a complex biological process starting with photosynthesis. Using
sunlight, carbon dioxide and water, plants produce carbohydrates. Through a
multitude of biological processes both in the plant body and in the soil, and
involving different groups of microorganisms and symbioses, humus is formed in
the soil. Humus formation is effectively carbon sequestration.
The presence of humus in soil leads to healthy plant growth. A certain quality
of care is required to maintain the health of soil that is rich in humus -
chemicals should not be used, and the ground should not be left exposed and
bare. Should one partake in regenerative practices and commits to cultivating
good soil, it is possible to improve soil conditions significantly; in 3-4 years
time, the resultant soil which has become dark and rich in humus will serve as
an effective carbon sink.
While the government has been actively calling for the reduction of carbon
emissions as a response to climate change, Mr Tang expresses that there are also
great merits in encouraging greater participation in regenerative forms of
farming and gardening. This increased capacity to sequester carbon through
regenerative farming practices is also a viable response to climate change.
There is no certainty about turning the tide on climate change or the potential
of positive outcomes, but Mr Tang remains steadfast in his view that it is only
necessary and responsible to do something about it. In recent weeks, Mr Tang has
been spending his time at a local secondary school where he has been invited to
support the school in setting up an edible garden. He hopes that the garden
would provide opportunities for him to share his knowledge and experiences with
the students, and in doing so, provide rich learning about carbon sequestration
and environmental sustainability through natural farming methods.
Ground-up Initiative (GUI), where Mr Tang currently practices natural farming,
is an non-governmental organization that seeks to nurture a connection to earth
and community through woodcraft, farming and agriculture. For the last 10 years
since its inception, GUI has drawn people from different walks of life through
its programmes and activities. Koo Hui Ying, a full-time staff at GUI, believes
that it is through farming that one arrives at a profound awareness and
understanding of climate change. She expresses that the unpredictable weather
patterns have somewhat disrupted the typical growing and harvesting cycles;
while one may come to expect a higher frequency of thundery showers during the
year-end period, last December turned out to be hot and dry. Hui Ying believes
that climate change would have a direct and significant impact on our lives. She
feels that there is tremendous potential in the community when individuals
assume personal responsibility and take active steps in climate change
mitigation. GUI hopes to initiate more engagement programmes so as to be able to
interest people who may not otherwise pay much attention to sustainability,
supporting the collective effort for environmental conservation.

果祥法師

 Simple but Great Food
By Guo Hsiang Fa-shi

 Thursday, January 24, my part-time volunteer together with his wife, his son,
and his daughter have been riding bicycles from Puxin, Changhua, a centeral
country of Taiwan, for totally five days, and finally arrived at Chung－Hwa
Institute of Buddhist Culture in Beitou,Taipei, at six o'clock in the early
evening.

 I cooked a pot of noodle soup for their dinner. Then they went on their trip,
approximately taking them a two-and-a-half-hour ride to reach the hotel.

 The next morning, the volunteer told me that his wife, his children, and
himself felt different on their ride last night. And their resilience in the
morning was different from that of their four previous days. After having the
noodle soup last night, he and his family continually rode for thirteen
kilometers, completely felt no drowsiness. Neither did his daughter. His son,
with a cold and a fever, woke up and ate up all the packed noodles this morning.
He feels much better now! What we eat really matters!

 I gave them noodles made of Taiwanese whole wheat, no chemicals, tofu,
vegetables, turnips, carrots, peanuts, dried ginger, and oil. All were great in
quality, nothing bad in them.

 The meal was not heavy, but was really great! After having it, people working a

他的農產品的質地，比一般的好得多，然而他出售的價格，比一般的便宜。他說因為他的付出少、成本低丶收成好，當然可以比別人便宜。他的自然稻的收成，便超過日本的平均值。

 
優良的質地、豐富的收成丶便宜的價格，証明福岡先生的想法是正確的。然而，福岡先生固然在日本的知名度相當高，日本國內卻沒有太多人運用他的理念和方式耕種。他的農業哲學似乎深邃難懂，然而他所提倡的實踐方法，卻是容易操作、施行的。問題在於人的積習難改，權利結構丶利益衝突等等問題，太難破除！或許也是因為容易，反而令人難以接受！

 
福岡先生寫過八本書，他最有名的大作＂一根稻草的革命＂被翻譯成許多不同國家的語言。在中國大陸和臺灣，都有人譯成簡體和繁體中文流通，他在晚年走訪過十多個國家，會見過許多領袖，關懷世界各地的環境問題、農業現況，和推廣他的自然農法。他的貢獻使他贏得印度最高榮譽奬Deshikottan
Award及菲律賓的麥格塞塞獎The Roman Magsasay Award 和地球環境高峰會議議長設立的國際NGO The Earth Council
獎。因此，他的國際聲望很高，知道他的人很多。

 
這次全程陪伴我們參訪的福岡先生生前秘書兼英語翻譯，矢島三枝子女士説，實際在實踐福岡農法的人分散在日本各地，以及義大利丶奧地利、法國丶希臘丶南美丶印度等國。在台灣，自然農業界中，仰慕福岡先生的人很多，但是似乎還沒有人明白表示，自己施行的是福岡農法。

 福岡先生發明的不耕地稻麥連播法，在中國大陸，因為有顧克禮先生的推廣，已經有浙江丶江蘇、湖南丶湖北等四個省份，無數的農人施行，成效卓著！

 
8月16日，我們在福岡農園的森林中，看到柑橘樹夾雜在雜木林中，整個果園保有一片原始森林的模樣。豐厚的落葉層，使得土壤肥沃鬆輭，即使是在光線不足的森林裡，柑橘樹與許多其他樹木的葉片，既厚又韌而閃閃發光，反應出這片森林的生機旺盛丶能量充沛，這樣的環境中生產出來的水果，可以想見它的風味丶能量丶養份，都是優秀獨特的。

 
我們到訪時，已經過了夏柑採收期，整片山林沒有柑橘果實，但是卻有從四面八方而來的芳香。在這粗放的山林裡，福岡大師的孫子大樹先生，正實驗以里山觀念，種植柑橘以外的其他作物，目前還在摸索階段中。福岡大樹先生說，這裡有五種野生水果，對人來說並不可口，但是對於野生動物卻是佳餚。

 
林中有一座大約二三十坪大的舊房子，是福岡正信先生曾經住過五十年的地方。另有一個小房子，則是會客交誼的地方，後來不夠用，福岡正信先生在小屋前，和他的夥伴們，一起搭建一座他個人設計的木造八角亭。這座亭工法非常特別，完全沒有用到釘子，或鋼筋等，全部只有木頭和繩子而已。外型相當美觀，高大寬敞，可以容納近百人。福岡正信先生在生命後期的三十年中，便用它來接待來自世界各地的訪客，講學、論道丶流布思想，尤其是指導農法的地方。

 
山腳下，另有一區柑橘園，是採用集約精耕的方式種植。園內的柑橘，是五十年前福岡正信先生種植的。半個世紀的歲月裡，土壤冲刷掉大約三十公分厚。因此我們看到每一棵樹的樹根，都露出土面一長段。不過，果樹似乎蠻健康的，放眼望去，整片果園的樹葉，看不到枯黃丶生病或蟲咬的痕跡。平均一棵果樹一年生產150公斤柑橘。

 
福岡大樹先生表示，二十年前這片果園，曾經暴發嚴重的天牛危機，因此砍掉不少柑橘樹。我們看到許多樹頭，都有天牛鑽的大洞，現在的園主使用石膏塞進洞裡，或在樹頭圍鉄網以保護柑橘樹有了成效。福岡農場也種稻麥，我們來時，稻禾大約六七十公分高，尚未結橞，整片稻禾的顏色呈現淡緑，不若一般肥料重的稻禾，顏色那麼深綠。

 
去年起，福岡大樹先生把祖父福岡正信先生在世時的穀倉，整理成福岡紀念館，兼福岡農場產品流通處。可供陳列的福岡手稿丶用品丶照片等仍在收集中。到訪這天，我們看到流通的農產品有夏柑果汁、果醬、糯米丶麵粉、䓤頭，和以福岡農法在意大利生產的橄欖壓榨的進囗橄欖油。我癹現含一點這種橄欖油在口中，對於消除口腔炎和喉嚨痛效果極佳。它有小麥草汁的味道，而且相當辛辣，與我們一般接觸到的橄欖油差異極大，這麼好的橄欖油，因為是以福岡自然農法栽種的橄欖壓榨的油吧！

 A visit to Masanobu Fukuoka's Farm
(Guo Hsiang Fa-Shi)

 Among the natural farming approaches that I know of, only Masanobu Fukuoka's
approach is based on the philosophy of Buddhism. He emphasized that the
philosophy behind farming is the most important.

 When Fukuoka was 25 years old, he had an awakening. His thoughts therefore
concur with Buddhism's dharma. In his books, "The One-Straw Revolution" and "The
Natural Way of Farming", Fukuoka emphasizes that farming should be guided by
Buddhist philosophy. He named his natural farming approach as Farming method of
the Dharma or the Buddhist farming method.

 When Fukuoka first began practicing his natural farming, he had no examples to
learn from, no books to refer to. Through strong will and determination, he
practiced natural farming for 50 years.

 His farm produce was of very good quality, but he sold it at a low price. He
explained that using his farming approach, the labour input and cost was low,
but the yield was good both in quality and quantity, hence he should sell his
produce at a low price. His paddy yield was higher than Japanese national
average!

 Although Fukuoka was well-known and his farming approach had produced good
results in terms of quality and high yield of crops, not many Japanese followed
his methods. His farming philosophy might appear to be difficult to understand,
but his methods and practices were actually simple and easy to carry out.
Perhaps it was difficult for people to make a paradigm shift from the well
established commercial agriculture systems, which focused more on financial
benefits.

 Among the 8 books that Fukuoka had written, "The One-Straw Revolution" is the
most famous one. It has been translated into many languages. Many leaders around
the world who care about environment and farming would praise highly Fukuoka's
natural farming approach. He had won India's Deshikottan Award, Philippines'
Roman Magsaysay Award and Earth Council Award.

 Fukuoka's former secretary and English translater, Ms. 矢島三枝子, accompanied us
during our visit to Fukuoka's farm. She said that there are farmers practicing
Fukuoka's natural farming methods in Japan, Italy, Austria, France, Greece,
South American countries, etc. In Taiwan, many farmers within the natural
farming community admire Fukuoka's way of natural farming, but apparently none
follow his approach closely.

 In China, Mr Gu Ke Li is promoting Fukuoka's method of zero-tillage to sow
wheat after rice harvest and has had promising results. This method has been
adopted in 4 provinces: Zhejiang, Jiangsu, Hunan and Hubei.

 On 16 August, we visited Fukuoka's orchard and saw the citrus trees growing
among other wild trees. The orchard felt like a wild forest. The soil was kept
soft, moist and fertile by a thick layer of leaf litter. Even in the shaded
light of the forest, the thick leaves on the trees were healthily shiny. The
orchard was full of vigour and energy. The fruits produced in this orchard must
be nutritious, and full of flavours.

 We arrived at Fukuoka's orchard after the harvest season. Although there were
no fruits in sight, we were greeted with a kind of natural fragrance from all
around. Mr. 大樹先生, grandson of Fukuoka, was trying out the Saroyan's concept and
planted other crops in their citrus orchard. Mr. 大樹先生 told us that there were 5
types of wild fruit trees in their orchard. Although humans don't find them
appealing, wild animals love these wild fruits.

 In the orchard, there was a old house of about 90 metres squared. Fukuoka lived
in this small house for 50 years. There was a small room in the house where
Fukuoka used to meet his guests. As the number of guests and visitors grew, he
needed a bigger place. He designed a 8-sided pavilion and built it in front of
his house with his friends with wood and ropes only, no metal or nails were
used. The pavilion was elegantly designed, tall and spacious, and could
accommodate up to 100 people. In this pavilion, Fukuoka, in the last 30 years of
his life, received international guests, holding talks, discussions on natural
farming.

 There is another citrus orchard at the foot of the hill. A comparatively more
intensive farming approach was used in this orchard. The citrus trees were
planted by Fukuoka himself 50 years ago. About 30 cm of soil had been washed
away naturally in these 50 years, hence some of the tree roots were above the
soil surface. However, the trees were still strong and healthy, showing no signs
of diseases or pests. Each citrus tree produced 150 kg of fruits annually.

 Mr. 福岡大樹 told us that there was an infestation of longhorn beetles 20 years ago
and they had to cut down many citrus trees. We could see the holes made by the
beetles in the lower part of the tree trunks. The current orchard owner now
either used plaster to fill the holes or wrapped the tree trunks with wire mesh,
which seemed to be effective in protecting the trees from longhorn beetles. Rice
and wheat are also grown in Fukuoka Farm. We saw the rice plants, about 70 cm
tall, in light green colour, unlike those with deep green colour grown with
heavy usage of fertilizers.

 Since last year, Mr. 福岡大樹 has been converting Masanobu Fukuoka's old barn into
Fukuoka Memorial Hall and also a place for the display and sale of their farm
products. On the day of our visit, we saw items for sale such as orange juice,
jam, glutinous rice, wheat flour, onion bulbs and olive oil produced in Italy
using Fukuoka's farming method. I noticed that just putting a little of this
olive oil in the mouth could alleviate stomatitis and sore throat. It has the
taste of wheat grass and is pungent, very different from the usual olive oil
that we can buy in the market. Perhaps, this is the best olive oil in existence.

要不要施肥呢？
李靜瑤

 最近，有人推薦一種肥料給我，他説這種肥料有特殊的營養成分，人吃了施放這種肥料的農作物，身體會變健康。

 這幾天，我一直在思考是否要測試這種肥料，想了很久以後，還是放棄了。

 
因為以前我做過實驗，把慣行，有機，和自然三種小黃瓜加水放置，經過10天以後，慣行與有機的小黃瓜，外型都糊掉了，而自然農法的小黃瓜還很完整。慣型和有機小黃瓜的味道都很臭，而自然農法的小黃瓜，則是酸酸的，猶如酵素的味道。

 有個朋友也實驗，把慣型與有機的小黃瓜切片放置，幾天以後兩種都腐爛了。慣型的小黃瓜，味道猶如化學物質，很刺鼻；有機的小黃瓜，發出有機肥的味道。

 肥料再怎麼好，還是人為的操控，不可能做到像大地的營養成份的均衡，所以我還是堅持不施肥。

 Recently someone recommended a kind of fertilizer to me. The person told me the
fertilizer consisted of special nutrition ingredients, making people healthy
after eating the crop fertilized by it.

 I have been thinking these days whether testing this fertilizer on my farm or
not. After a long period of consideration, I decided not to use it.

 The reason was I made an experiment long time ago, putting three kinds of
cucumbers in water: a conventional-farming cucumber, an organic-farming
cucumber, and a natural-farming cucumber. After ten days, the
conventional-farming one and the organic-farming one were rotten while the
natural-farming cucumber was in good shape. In addition, after soaking in the
water for ten days, the conventional-farming cucumber and the organic-farming
one smelled stinky, but natural-farming cucumber smelled as sour as the enzyme.

 A friend of mine experimented as well, cutting the cucumber into pieces and
putting them in the air. After a few days, both of them were rotten. The
conventional-farming cucumbers smelled as chemicals and very pungent; the
organic-farming one spread out the smell of organic fertilizer.

 No matter how great the fertilizer is, it is still manipulated by human. It
cannot balance all the nutrients as the Mother Earth does. Therefore I still
insist on not using any fertilizers.

himself has been growing ginger using continuous cropping system for eight
years.

 This is such a big contrast to the conventional practice of ginger growers, who
would fallow the land for eight years after growing a crop of ginger.

 "When I was a child," Mr Wong added, "my mother had a millennium ginger garden.
The ginger harvested from that garden had a fragrance that I would never forget.
Only at my 6th year of continuous cropping did I get ginger with that
fragrance!"

 He continued: "If a conventional farmer plants a ginger root the size of a palm
in spring, he will harvest 25 kg of old ginger in winter. If he grows ginger on
a land of area 650 square metres, he would get 1200 kg of ginger. That's a very
good yield. Before they plant the ginger roots, these farmers soak them in a
suspension of copper powder and lime powder. This is even more toxic than
formalin used in the past."

 "After preparing the land, they add chemical fertilizers, general as well as
highly toxic pesticides. During the growing period, they spray pesticides once
every 12 days, apply fertilizers once every 20 days. The ginger roots they
harvest are big and look perfect."

 "However, the microorganisms and other soil creatures are almost all killed.
The natural soil physical and chemical properties has been badly damaged. This
is the reason why no crops can be grown on the same piece of land for the next
eight years."

 Mr Wong added that the soil used to plant ginger is extremely loose and is good
for planting any crop. 

 This could be proven from my own experience of planting ginger too.

layer of Chinese silvergrass pieces. He said that the pieces produce natural
Actinobacteria which protects the ginger from diseases. This is his secret of
success in the continuous cropping of ginger. However, covering silvergrass
after the month of June does not yield good results. So this needs to be done
before June.

drainage in the farming area is essencial too. Slopes or vegetable patches with
an increased height are preferable.

rhizome grows into long knobs. Mr Wong hills it with small amounts of soil
fifteen times a year. The reason is to prevent snails from eating its fresh
shoots. This also facilitates the rhizome to extend sideways. His ginger grows
in short knobs due to the slight hilling.

 He said that ginger cultivated this way is potent and is effective in treating
ailments. Ginger promotes Chi and blood circulation, and warms the body. It is
also a good source of antioxidant. But it is not advisable to take too much

to take care of than shallow-rooted and short-term vegetables. But surprisingly,

proven feasible at the Fu-He natural farm.

務農﹒悟農
郭淑娟

 二十四歲前，我是都市人，從來不懂踩踏泥土、親近農作物是什麼滋味。剛來宜蘭時，還鬧過笑話，我在週邊環繞著稻田的校園裡問同事：在哪裡可以看到稻子呢？
得知法鼓山蘭陽精舍開辦＂心靈環保自然農法班＂我在上課前一天報名了。

 三月二十五日第一次實作，我們帶著一份對大地的尊重與敬仰而來。和煦的陽光，溫暖了在田裡精進的新手農夫；拂面的清風，撫慰著辛勤耕作的我們。

 我們在農地開挖三十公分後，底層舖上樹枝，再用落葉、青草層層堆疊而上，然後鋪上姑婆芋的葉子，以阻擋日光，避免雜草復活，接著在姑婆芋葉子上面戳洞，幫助水分滲透。

 
我們把菜畦做成美麗的同心圓造型。作物方面，除了考慮加入忌避作物，以達到防蟲效果外，就連顏色的搭配也別具匠心，你能想像那「菜團錦簇」的美麗景象嗎？我們熱切期待著。

 
主要作物圓茄、紫色萵苣、甜菜根一一植入土壤後，斜插的薄荷也擔下地被植物的任務蓄勢待發。細碎的落葉覆蓋了整個菜畦，溫柔地呵護著土壤，避免陽光蒸發太多水分，大雨衝刷掉表土。

 
自然農法的每一個步驟，無不是對大地的呵護，敬人者人恆敬之，同樣的，愛護大地，大地也會回饋我們永續的豐美作物。如果我們有方法能讓大地孕育健康的作物，又為何要以農藥、化肥、除草劑來殘害他，也讓這樣的傷害進入人體內。

 初次當農夫，深深體會「汗滴禾下土」的滋味，雖然辛苦，內心卻洋溢著喜悅。「務農」也「悟農」，這一天，我體驗了農人的辛勤，同時也領悟了自然農法深切呵護大地的精神。

 Engaged in Farming, Awakened to Farming
Guo Shu Juen

 Before the age of 24, I was a city dweller who never knew how it feels to be
stepping on the soil or being close to crops. When I first came to Yilan, I
embarrassed myself and created a joke by asking colleagues in our school
surrounded by rice fields, “Where can I see rice plants?”

 Having known that DDM Yilan was starting a natural farming class, I registered
a day before the class.

 On 25 March, we attended the first practical session, with a sense of respect
and admiration for Mother Earth. The genial sunshine brought warmth to the
diligent new farmers in the field. The refreshing breeze that brushed against
our face soothed all of us who were working hard.

 On the farmland, having dug a patch to the depth of 30 centimeters, we placed a
layer of twigs on the bottom, then piled up with alternate layers of fallen
leaves and green grass, finally topping with night-scented lily leaves to shade
it from sunlight and also to prevent weeds from reviving. Then we poked holes on
the lily leaves to allow water to seep through.

 We shaped the vegetable patch into beautiful concentric circles. As for crops,
apart from the consideration of introducing pest-repelling crops, we also showed
much ingenuity in combining various colors of the crops. Can you imagine the
delightful scene of the rich multicolored creation of vegetables? We look
forward to it eagerly.

 After the main crops of eggplants, purple lettuce, and beetroot were planted,
the obliquely cut peppermint beared the task of groundcover, well-poised for
growth. Shredded leaves covered the entire vegetable bed, gently protecting the
soil, preventing sunlight from evaporating too much water, and heavy rain from
washing away the topsoil.

 Every step of natural farming is invariably the protection of the earth. A
respectful person is always respected. Similarly, when caring for the earth, it
will reciprocate with a continued supply of lush crops. If we have the methods
to help the earth produce healthy crops, why would we use pesticides, chemical
fertilizers, and herbicides that create so much damage, and let such
contamination enter the human body?

 As a first-time farmer, I deeply appreciates how it feels when ‘sweat drips
down onto the rice-field’. Although it is arduous, the heart is filled with joy.
Being engaged in farming, I am also awakened to farming. On this day, I
experienced the industriousness of a farmer. I also learned that natural farming
is very much about the spirit of deep concern and care for the earth.

經歷三季的高麗菜
果祥法師

 記得二O一七年六月八日，我帶著學生參訪福和自然田時，看到幾棵前一年十二月種的高麗菜，已經包起來了，但還沒有很成熟。

 它經歷過春季以來，蝶蛾幼蟲喜好寄生於十字花科的漫漫長期，卻看不到什麼蟲洞，不是靠驅避手法，而是順應自然多元混合種植，和不施肥達到的效果。

 Repellent-Free Cabbages
By Guo-Hsiang Fa-shi

 It came to my mind that on June 8th, 2017, I led my students to visit Fu He
Natural Garden in Yulin, Taiwan. We saw a few cabbages planted in December of
the previous year. They had been wrapped up, but were still not very mature.

 They experienced the long spring that was the favorable weather condition and
Crucifers for larvae of butterflies and moths. No holes, however, were seen on
the cabbages. It was not because of using the insect repellent, but the effects
of Nature adapting, multiple mixed planting, and no fertilizer.

這是我們這一期金山農地的芥菜，成長過程一直有蟲咬，但是到採收時蟲洞很少。

 原因可能是：

 1、蟲有季節性，過一段時間就少了。

 2、天敵出現抑制了蟲。

 3、健康的植物，具備自己修補的能力。

 4、植株經蟲咬後，抗體變強，蟲不愛吃了。新葉不斷長出，舊葉慢慢枯萎、掉落，後來就看不到蟲洞了。

 Our current crop of leaf mustard had been bitten by bugs throughout its growing
period. Surprisingly, there were very few bite marks on the leaves when we
harvested it.

 The possible reasons for this are:

 1. Pests are seasonal. After a certain period, the pests would mostly
disappear.

 2. Natural predators of pests came and effectively suppressed the pests.

 3. The plants were healthy and could eventually fend off the pests.

 4. After being bitten by the pests, the plants became more resistant and less
attractive to pests. As new leaves replaced the old bitten leaves, there were
much fewer bite marks seen.

葛鬱金盛產
果祥法師

 
我今天（1/19）大開眼界：北投菜園有一叢葛鬱金的塊根，一條一條緊靠在一起，密得像刷子的毛一樣，而且每一條都是那麼地肥大，印象中，從沒看過這麼大的葛鬱金，超級多加超級大，光是一叢，就大概採了四五斤（以上？）

 這五年來，那一帶不管是種芋頭或豆薯都長得不錯，葛鬱金尤其好，而且年年更好，什麼原因？大概是倒下的香蕉桿，供給它們許多養份吧。

 我沒有施放任何肥料，也沒有舖或埋雜草、樹葉，只是偶而澆澆水，（也很少幫它們除雜草，）收成卻是這麼好！怎麼能說不施肥作物就長不好呢？

 註一：這次收成的葛鬱金，帶有月桃花香，這也是前所未見的。

 註二：那塊地我從2013年5月1日租到，至今不曾施肥。
在我之前，地主種筊白筍，我租之前水早已乾涸，筊白筍桿在田間自然慢慢分解，提供了很多腐植植，餵養了很多微生物，我又休耕了一期讓它長草，那年秋冬我種葉菜、蘿蔔等，都長得不錯，五年下來也一直都不錯。

 My vegetable garden located in Beitou surprised and impressed me today. The
root tubers of the arrowroots grew one by another as little children lined up.
Furthermore, each one of them grew thick and big. This bunch, for instance,
weighted approximately 2.4 kilograms to 3 kilograms! Other bunches never grew
like this. I have never seen such big arrowroots in my life!

 In this part of the garden, taros or bean yams grew very well these years. The
arrowroots, especially, grew much better than those in the previous year. I have
been thinking about the reasons. Perhaps the banana poles nearby fell down,
nurturing the arrowroots.

 In the process, I did not spread any fertilizers, nor cover or burry weeds or
leaves. I just watered them occasionally, even seldom weeding for them. The land
is still with great harvest! Are we going to keep on expressing that plants or
crops grow worse without fertilizers?

對有機農業的見聞、感想
李靜瑤

 踏入農業這行，不知不覺已經十多年。這段時間，看到有機農業的變化，感覺上是逐漸退步，很擔心會退回到慣行農業去。

 農友為了要讓作物長得快而完美，肥料越用越多，防治病蟲的資材，也很勤快地用。

 曽聽到一位有機農戶跟另一位說，空心菜撒下種子到採收是16天，一個月可以種兩次。

 我很驚訝！這是壓榨土地！跟慣行農業的差異，只在西藥換中藥，沒有真正愛護土地！

 我是不是太悲觀了？

 My knowledge and reflections on organic farming
by Lee Qing yau 

 It has been more than a decade lsince I entered the field of agriculture.
Witnessing the changes in organic agriculture over this period of time, I feel
that it is gradually regressing and I was quite worried that we would return to
conventional farming.

 Farmers use more and more fertilizers in order for crops to grow fast and well,
and resources for pest control are also used frequently.

 I once heard from an organic farmer sharing with another, saying that it takes
16 days for water spinach to be harvested from the day it is sown. This gives
him two harvests a month. 

 I'm shocked! This is exploiting the land! The difference between this and
conventional agriculture would then be likened to the change from taking Western
medicine to Chinese medicine, and there is no real care and concern for the
land! 
Am I too pessimistic?

法鼓山蘭陽分院，自然農法班實作農地的長豆今天（9/23）很豐收，才那麼幾棵就採了一大堆，茂密的豆葉，也可以做菜，還蠻好吃的。

 Today (23 Sep.) we harvested many string beans from only a few plants. The
thick leaves of the plants also provided delicious food for us.

地瓜葉説
陳櫻花

 我生長在福和自然田園，
主人沒有給我們肥料吃，也沒有用農藥幫我們驅蟲、治病。

 我們用自己的力量成長，也很漂亮、可愛，吃過的人都很懷念我們。

 雖然我們必須自食其力地成長，我仍然非常喜歡生在這裡，這裡所有的果樹和蔬菜都跟我們一樣，必須自己伸長根鬚去覓食。

 不過，其實主人也有保護我們。他在土壤表層覆蓋香茅或草葉，我們的根就不會裸露曝曬太陽，或被雨水沖刷受傷，也因為有覆蓋，土裡有很多微生物，和我們的根部做養分交換。

 微生物與蚯蚓會因為覓食，不斷地翻土，我們的根鬚，就可以往更深的土層伸展，大雨來了土地積水的時候，伸到深層的根，仍然可以呼吸，不會因為淹大水而窒息。

 雖然凡事自己來很辛苦，卻也因為如此奮鬥，我們展現了地瓜葉本來的風味。

 比起附近鄰田的植物，我們算是非常幸運的，在這裡的植物，都不會吃農藥，不管下雨或晴天，無論是幼苗還是成熟，主人從來不使用農藥。

 
這樣的壞處是生病了，要自己尋求其他植物協助，或用氣味吸引能幫忙的昆蟲來協助我們，運氣好的話就會痊癒，運氣不好就會死去，主人也不管，他說這是自然現象，物競天擇適者生存不適者淘汰。當然也有好處，那就是不必有病無病都要吃藥(通掃)。

 有些小病或小蟲干擾，其實是無傷大雅的，可以自然痊癒何必吃藥？就算我只是名不見經傳的地瓜葉，仍然期望在自然界中，訓練強健的體質，傳承下去，讓一代更勝於一代。

 
在福和自然田園的地瓜葉，都是年輕漂亮的，主人會在我們的新芽長到大約30公分，正當風姿灼灼的時候，將我們採下，因為這個長度的地瓜葉，就像人類的20-30歲間，正是精力最旺盛的階段，營養含量最多最豐富；若此時沒採收再延期，我們的心蕊，會因為養分供應不足而細長，既沒有旺盛時好吃，也失去了好商品的價值。

 總之，雖然我是植物，我也要選擇活在福和自然田園，這裡是植物的天堂，也是人類選擇好食物的處所。

 What the sweet potato leaves say
Chen Ying Hua

 We live in Fu He Natural Farm. Our owner do not feed us with fertilizers.
Neither do they use pesticides and chemicals to fight off pests and diseases.

 We use our own strength to grow and become beautiful and lovely. People who
have tested us will never forget us.

 Although we need to depend on our ourselves to grow, we enjoy living in this
farm. Like us, all the fruit trees and crops here need to find their nutients in
the soil themselves, and therefore we all develop longer and stronger roots.

 Our owner would put lemongrass leaves, grass and other leaves on the soil. This
will protect our roots from the harsh sun. Also because of the mulch layer, the
soil microbes thrive and happily exchange nutrients with our roots.

 Because of the movement of soil creatures like earthworms, the soil becomes
loose enough for our roots to grow deeper into the soil. If there is flood
because of rain, our deep roots can still breathe in the deep soil.

 We are not pampered. We need to strive against stress as we grow. This makes us
healthier and stronger and taste better too!

 Compared to the crops in the neighbouring farm, we are luckier here. Our owner
never uses any chemical pesticides or fungicides under any circumstances. When
we are sick or have pest attacking us, there may be other plants around that can
help us. We can also call for help from some predatory insects by releasing
special scents. If we are lucky, we get well. If not, we die. Our owner says
this is nature's way - survival of the fittest. In fact, we can often recover
from minor diseases and pest problems. In this way, our immune system will build
help and it passes on to our future generations.

 In Fu He Natural Farm, the sweet potato leaves are all young and beautiful. Our
owner harvests us when our new shoots are about 30 cm long, in the prime of our
life, with lots of energy and nutrients, just like a human in his/her 20's. If
we are harvested later than this, our shoots will become too long and slender
and do not taste so good.

 Fu He Natural Farm is a paradise for plants and crops. It is also a place where
people can find good food.

八月南台灣暴雨後的省思

 1.李靜瑤：

 八月下旬的暴雨，我觀察到農場的農地裡不積水，而農場旁邊的馬路上坑坑洞洞積水不退，還有好多蝌蚪，浮遊在水中。
這應該也是被壓實的土地，和不耕耘的土地的差異！

 2.林振源：

 這次的823大淹水，福和農場無恙，只倒了三棵香蕉。

 我們的田有打破不透水層，雖然豪雨臨田都淹水，我們的田因為不透水層破了，雨水往地下滲，地面的水很快就消退了。

 也因為土壤鬆軟，果樹和農作物能夠向下扎根，雖然強風仍然屹立，
感恩自然農法的奧妙。

 五年多來經過好幾次風災水災，福和自然田園的作物，損失都降到最低。

 豪雨一天一夜之後，早上九時拍攝，左右的鄰田淹水 ，福和沒積水 。

 3.陳櫻花：

 
政府的各項建設，都忽略了地氣對流，甚至用柏油或水泥封住地面，好比將人的呼吸出口封住，氣出不來也進不去，如果挖開土壤一尺深以下，用手去抓裡面的土，就會感到溫緩，和有地氣在流動，那是另一類眾生生存的世界，地底下生物存活的好與壞，攸關我們地上生物生活的安危。

 請重視大地，不要再破壞土壤，給大自然裡的所有生靈，都有安適的存活空間，人類也才會幸福！

 Contemplation after Heavy Rain

 1. by Lee Qing Yau

 Heavy rainfall in late August damaged many crops severely. I noticed that water
in the many potholes on the road outside my farm did not recede. There were even
tadpoles swimming in these holes. However my farm was not flooded by water from
the rain. 

 This is the difference between compacted land and natural farming land.

 2. by Lin Zong Yuan

 The Hu Ho farm was fine through the heavy rain of August 23. Only three banana
trees fell down.

 We had broken the compacted water-proof layer of soil crust underground
previously and water filtration in our farm was excellent. Although our
neighbouring farmland was flooded, surface runoff in our farm subsided soon
after the rain and that had prevented our farm from being damaged by the heavy
downpour. 

 And because the soil is tender and soft the roots of the fruit trees and crops
spread far and deep under the earth. Even strong wind would not cause the trees
to collapse.

 After the heavy rain that lasted for one day and night, I recorded a short
video showing how the nearby lands were soaked by water while our farm was fine.

 Thanks to the natural method of farming, the damage of Fu He farm was reduced
to the minimum through the few severe storms and floods in the past five years. 

 3. by Chen Yin Hwa

 The government neglected to protect air circulation under the ground while
doing constructions. It is just like covering the opening of conspiracy. If you
dig up the earth deep down to one meter under the earth you will notice that the
warmth of the soil. That is the living place of other creatures. The fortune and
happiness of those living beings is deeply related to humanity.

 Please pay attention to the earth and let all the beings living under the soil
be comfortable.Then the humanity could have fortune.

text:
田裡的三姊妹
李靜瑤

 豆類、玉米、瓜類，印地安人稱為三姐妹，它們可以種在一起。
我常常把菜豆、絲瓜跟玉米種在一起，原因是：

 1.
長豆、絲瓜都需要種在有攀爬的設施中，它們種植的間距大，小時候不會互相遮光。又因為種植間距大，兩顆中間可以種玉米。玉米是一支支長上來，不怕跟其他作物互相交纏。

 2. 春天種玉米，大約3個月可以採收，長豆約兩個多月，絲瓜約3個月。因為完全不施肥，所以長不快，但營養成分比一般的更高。

 3. 長豆、絲瓜都是連續性採收，採收期大約2~3個月，包含種植時間，在田裏有5~6個月。（絲瓜的採收期比長豆長。）

 4. 玉米是一次性採收，採收以後就多出空間給長豆和絲瓜使用。

 5.用這樣的種植方式，能夠一次照顧三種作物。種植加採收期長，就能減少動到土地的時間，少干擾土中的生物，少破壞土壤的物理結構和化學性。

 6.長豆是豆科，它的根有根瘤菌，有固氮作用，是自然農法的肥料植物，能夠幫助其他作物生長。

 The Three sisters in the field
Li Jingyao

 Beans, corn and melons are referred to as the three sisters by native Americans
as they can be planted together. I often cultivate beans, loofah and corn
together. The reasons are as follows:

 1. Long beans and loofah need to be planted with climbing support. They are
planted far apart so that they will not block each other as young plants. Due to
the large gaps between the plants, corn can be grown in between these crops.
Corn grows upright and does not have problems getting intertwined with them.

 2. In spring, corn could be harvested in about 3 months, long beans take about
two months, and loofah about 3 months. Because they are not fertilized at all,
they do not grow fast, but the nutrient contents are higher than usual plants.

 3. Long beans and loofah could be continuously harvested for a period of about
2~3 months. From the time they are sown, they grow for 5~6 months in the farm.
(The harvest period of loofah is longer than that of the long beans.)

 4. Corn is harvested only once. After harvest, there is more space for long
beans and loofah.

 5 With this style of cultivation, you can take care of three crops at a time.
Longer planting and harvesting period reduce the frequency of plowing the land.
This reduces interference and creates less damage to the physical structure and
chemical properties of the soil.

 6. Long beans belong to the leguminous family. The rhizobium in its roots
contribute to nitrogen fixation. It is thus used as a fertilizing plant in
natural farming and it helps other crops to grow.

text:
有健康的泥土才有使人健康的食物（中文版在英文版下面) 新加坡 鄧洪斌

 Soil security is the necessary condition for food security, not high technology

 I am very concerned about the future of agriculture in Singapore.

 In order to achieve food security in our land-scarce nation, the mainstream and
government thinking here is that the country needs to develop high-technology
agriculture such as multi-tier hydroponic systems using LED lights and data
analytics, multi-storey farms that use robotics and automated soil-less
cultivation. According to Singapore's Agri-Food & Veterinary Authority (AVA),
"the future in our food security lies in a modern and technologically-savvy farm
sector that is fuelled by agricultural professionals, or ‘agri-technologists’
and ‘agri-specialists’."
https://www.ava.gov.sg/…/avavision/I…/future_of_farming.html

 Already, I can see heavy machinery and workmen clearing and flattening large
parcels of agricultural land on the west of Singapore island to prepare the
sites for future high-tech farms.

 No, I do not think that high technology will ensure food security. If one
understands the nature of food growing, he/she would see that soil security is
the necessary condition for food security, not high technology.

 Healthy soils are necessary to produce healthy food and achieve sustainable
global food security.

 Unhealthy soils do not have the diversity of soil life to provide the nutrients
to support healthy crop growth, leading to systemic food and nutrient security
problems.

 I strongly believe that land scarcity in Singapore is an advantage in creating
many small farms which are close to where people live (consumers). It is easy to
see pockets of lawn area scattered throughout the island city. I hope the
Singapore government will see the values of small farms and the potential of
these lawn areas becoming productive small farms, growing food responsibly and
regeneratively, providing safe and nutritious food for the people - small farms
being part of food security in Singapore.

 Like many other cities, there is increasing interest in urban farming in
Singapore. People are concerned about food safety and nutrition and many are
interested in growing their own food. Our government should consider creating
conditions for people to establish community farms to feed themselves, not just
community gardens for recreational purposes, but small farms that are seriously
producing food in healthy soils. Perhaps, this can be the first steps towards
Rubanization, architect Tay Kheng Soon's reconceptualization of rural and urban
spaces as one same space, which brings greater balance to working, living,
learning, playing, farming and health within walkable distances.
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rubanisation

 我十分關心新加坡農業的發展。

 在土地有限的新加坡，政府和很多民眾認為為了食物保障，國家必須發展高科技農業，如室內LED 、氣耕，
智能環境控制系統、多層水耕種植、無土多層機械耕種系統等。新加坡農糧局的網站這樣説：“新加破的糧食保障有賴於一個精通科技的農業界、農業專家、專業人士和技術人員”。
https://www.ava.gov.sg/…/avavision/I…/future_of_farming.html

 在新加坡西部的農業區，正在大興土木，整平一片又一片的農地，以建造大型高科技種植場。

 如果暸解種植農作物的本質, 就可以知道健康的泥土，是安全食物的必要條件，而不是高科技。健康的泥土，才可以種出健康的作物，並為可持續性種植作出貢獻。
不健康的泥土，沒有足夠的土壤生物多樣性，不能提供完整的養份，使作物健康成長，人吃那樣的作物，也不利健康。

 
新加坡土地有限，其實是一個優㸃，可以在各區建立小型農場，使食物生産地更靠近民眾。新加坡各區都有不少綠地，其中不乏有條件建立小型農場之處，若能採用對人和環境友善的種植法，可為附近居民生産安全、營養的蔬果，這些社區農場，能成為食物保障的一部份。

 
跟世界很多城市一樣，新加坡有越來越多人，對都市農耕有興趣，也希望自己種出安全，和有營養的蔬果。我們的政府大可創造條件，在各區讓人民建立社區農場，不是休閒花園，而是具生產力的小型農場。

 新加坡資深建築師鄭慶順，提出城鄉融合的概念 (Rubanisation),
是把城市和農村融合在同一個空間，讓人們的工作、生活、休閒娛樂、學習、農耕、健康，有更好的連繫和平衡。希望我們在新加坡，能逐步實践這個概念。
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rubanisation

最近在line上，看到一位何姓農友以個人的慘痛經驗分享大家，她説：

 屏東有個農會，和某科大之前都推廣，在雨來菇園內舖不織布，我最早舖，也最早後悔，最早把不織布全部拿掉！

 因為我看到：不織布會吸水，在太陽照射下溫度非常高，雨來菇苗灑多少死多少。而且不織布有化學成份，對土壤和農作物，都有破壞性，造成農作物大幅弱化！

 請農友們不要重蹈她的覆轍！

 Recently on LINE, I saw a farmer by the surname of Mr Ho sharing her painful
personal experience with everyone. She said: 

 In southern Taiwan there is a farmer association, and also a local university
of technology which both promoted laying non-woven fabrics in Nostoc commune
farms. I was the first to do so, the first person who regretted it, and the
first to remove all the non-woven fabric! 

 It was because I saw that non-woven cloth absorbs water, creating very high
temperature under the sun. As much of Nostoc commune sprouts are sowed, that
much would die. Moreover, non-woven fabric consists of chemicals, which are
destructive to soil and crops, resulting in significant weakening of crops! 

 Fellow farmers, please don’t repeat the same mistake!

福和的一棵龍眼樹
果祥法師

 
六月11日，我和學生去福和自然田時，看到有一棵龍眼樹結實累累，不禁想到：今年台灣各地的龍眼受到椿象的危害相當嚴重，許多人擔心可能毫無收成。這棵果樹在沒有任何生物防治的情況下，最後結局將如何呢？

 今天，我看到福和女主人的訊息和照片，説龍眼已經成熟了。照片中，樹上的果實量多而完整，一如六月所見，似乎椿象並没有對它們造成什麼影響。

 The Longan Tree at Fu-ho Farm 
Guo Hsiang Fa-shi

 I visited Fu-ho natural farm with my students on June 11. On that day, I saw a
longan tree bearing numerous fruits. On viewing such a sight I was wondering,
‘In this year, all around Taiwan, stinkbugs have damaged countless longan
fruits. Yet here, the farm owner does not apply any method to prevent stinkbugs
from harming their produce. What would be the result of these fruits?

 Today I knew from the hostess of the farm that they have matured! The picture
shows that these fruits were just as bounty and pretty as I saw them two months
ago.

 It seems that the stinkbugs haven’t caused much problems to the longans.

今天是這學期第一次上戶外課。早上八點多，北投近郊和淺山飄著毛毛細雨，我們各自帶著雨傘和雨衣，在細雨中出坡。

 雖然沒什麼勞動，倒也全部菜園介紹了一圈，並扶起一座倒下的翼豆棚，到了十一點多才下山。

 回到住處，才莫約十多分鐘，竞然天色驟變，緊接著下起傾盆大雨，這一下持續了一個多小時，才稍稍收斂。

 如果這場豪大雨下在早上，我們肯定都成了落湯雞！我的内心有著無限的感恩！

text:
從心出發——農業創生研討會的心衝擊
頤嵐達 

 一場意義深遠的研討會，走在「從心出發」的路上，與對的人，在對的平台，進行對的交流，凝聚共識的力道之強，里程碑的意義之重大
，讓所有參與者深深相應，遲遲不願離場。

 
已然感受，在農業的領域中，提出「從心出發」的創見，須具足慈悲護生的願心，然而要實際行動，並在全球社會脈絡之下，作出一定成果，除了理念、汗水，更須智慧、毅力，以及四方和合的善因緣，因爲理念雖難得，但若單打獨鬥，很容易被各種壓力擊垮，因此這次研討會的重大意義包括：交流與凝聚理念、實作心得及資源分享。

 
研討會伊始，法鼓文理學院惠敏校長、法鼓山方丈和尚果暉法師，以及來自加拿大的常濟法師，和台大榮譽教授郭華仁老師，各從氣候變遷的嚴重性，「人與天」的和諧共存共榮，和聯合國SDG17(17項永續發展目標)，以及世界能源等問題的大格局著手鋪陳，雖屬概念層次的論述，但已能大開一般人對於農業領域的觀念框架，也開始把日常餐桌上的生活、社會脈絡和大地生命力的聯結，變得具體可行。

 後續談及的身土不二、家庭農業、社群聯結和社會平等正義等具體主張，依此而有了一脈相承的背景結構。

 
議題二中三位優秀的青農，是全場最令人驚艷的亮點。這些有想法，也懂得透過科技、知識等工具，擅用資源，不斷想「辦法」突破現狀的年輕人，實務上達成的力度，完全超出你我的想象。

 有一位青農為了保護鳥類棲地，想盡各種辦法，說服地主、農友支持他的計劃，
他們全心全力投入，以高標準達成目標的事實，聽眾鼓舞的，不只是有機農業的推廣成效，更是在生態保護的大目標下，扭轉逆境開出全新的格局。

 另一位24歲的「孩子」，有能力幫100多戶農友代耕，真是不可思議!
背後如果沒有深厚的願心，不可能扛得起這麼沉重的工作。而那沉穩深邃的思維和說服力，世間智的穿透洞察力，令我在敬佩之中，更有一份對自己於土地之漠然的慚愧。 

 
隨著議題的開展，一步步走向貼近個人的生活場域。韓國最成功的農產物流組織HANSALIM（韓莎林)的代表尹亨根先生，以農產運銷的角度，談消費者與生產者的關係，真正表述的，其實是消費模式，與生產行為背後的「心文明」，乃至生命的覺醒。近七十萬會員的大型組織，背後是靠著「三顆豆子」的精神哲學來支撐。

 
精神哲學當然可貴，但維持七十萬人的運作，如何落實精神哲學，保持不偏離絕非易事。剛好有因緣請教尹先生這個疑問，從他的回答中，知道HANSALIM在食農教育上，下了很大的功夫。這一點和法鼓山非常相應：教育，是改變一切的源頭！

 雲林古坑華南小學前校長陳清圳先生的分享，令人了解他對教育的用心投入，透過以偏鄉社區營造為媒介，改變人的認知，和實際行動到完全翻轉的程度，感人的力量何其強大！

 
研討會從人類、全球的大格局，一步步走到個人生活中時，個體經驗就非談不可了。五十嵐祐紀子女士談到家庭主婦在家裡，就可以同步與國際接軌，在餐桌上就能實踐救地球的環保生活，這點對我個人的衝擊相當大，所謂的「從自身作起」，再也不是空泛的口號。

 
另外，黃福君先生分享的，他們一家四口，可以減碳到一周只有一瓶不到的垃圾，難以想象，卻又如此真切地在眼前。內心的觸動，就是從這樣一個個不可思議的故事，和發表人的demo中，逐漸累積衝擊而成。每一段的分享，都是從心出發，從生命中的實證而來。而前後議題思維的串聯，和發表人分享所達到的高度、深度、廣度、力度，堪稱世界級的水準。使我兩天一晚下來，像一口氣聽了十幾場的TED
talk。

 
而主、協辦單位的工作人員與義工，在每一個崗位上的真誠、用心與細緻，也讓人感受到「從心出發」的落實，可以如此面面俱到，難怪韓國的尹亨根先生表示：「這次來參加研討會，像是遇到從未謀面、語言不通，但知心甚深的好朋友。」

 
在與聽眾互動的過程中，我也發現其中不乏在此議題上深耕多年的個人與團體代表。台上、台下彼此之間的交流，透露著相知相惜的氛圍。雖是研討會，卻遠遠超過學術研討會的框架，實際談論農地的實務領域，凝聚心靈、知識、願心與生命力！

 這次的研討會對個人的意義，不僅只在生活面，更已透入到生命反思的層次，會議圓滿後，內心默默地決定：「不論在哪個領域努力耕耘，要堅持做對的事！」

12 月19日，我和仕聰伉儷、哲敬、和長、炳榮⋯等一行人，去中寮探訪福君、于汾賢伉儷在中寮的農場。

 這塊地剛買了一年多，過去以種植柳丁和桂花為主，由於兩年多來沒有管理、照顧，加上乾旱，柳丁樹枯死不少，但也還有很多。目前，正值枊丁成熟，我們吃了許多美味的柳丁。

 
在一起的人，大多是農夫（專業或業餘)，大家互相關懷、學習，也一起分享自己的食物。中餐以姑婆芋的葉子代替碗盤，看來頗粗獷豪邁，這些食物幾乎都是自然農法，或友善有機種植的，這一餐吃得非常好。(旁邊還有很多食物)，

 這種聚會真是幸福！

大家多多支持好農夫、培植好農夫，大家才更有好東西吃，整體環境也才會更好！

以下這短文，是我籌辦＂心靈環保農業創生研討會＂的心得分享，已登於十二月份的法鼓雑誌，此平台同步發佈，敬請指教。

 
近年來，我從事友善有機的農法的推廣，也親自實驗無肥無防治的種植方式，因為我相信緣起的世間，一切環環相扣，而土壤中藴含的生物及元素不可思議，人類越少干預越好；也相信先進的營養學界的説法：人體需要的十萬種植物營養素，不是大量殺害蟲蟻，與大量施肥的蔬果所能具足。

 又近年來， 氣候變遷對人類造成的威脅愈演愈烈，其中的兇手－溫室氣體，四分之一來自農業，減少碳排放的農業已迫在眉睫。

 
今年適逢師父圓寂十周年，於是連結心靈環保、農業創生及氣候變遷的議題，在僧團支持下，邀集郭華仁、黃淑德、吳東傑等六位老師，成立諮詢小組，籌畫舉辦這場研討會，做為延續師父理念，報答師恩的系列活動之一。

 
開幕時，臺大生物資源暨農學院院長盧虎生的一段話，令人相當感動，他說：「氣候變遷的定義，即是因為人類活動，所造成的氣候變化，因此要解決、調適氣候變遷的影響，就必須回到人類活動的調適；而在以往的操作策略中，卻缺乏人為的心理調適，『心靈環保』正是解決氣候變遷最核心的問題。」

 
仰山基金會創辦人游錫堃先生在專題演講時，也指出：「維護環境，友善地球，從有機農業開始；食衣住行育樂，也都必須綠色消費，才能建造有機綠活的臺灣。」我聽了既歡喜也非常認同，但願有更多政府單位和民間團體及個人，一起努力推廣高品質的友善有機種植，並在生活各方面重視環保，減少溫室氣體排放，逆轉氣候變遷的問題。

 
兩天的研討會，所有的發表人和主持人都非常用心，聽眾的反應非常好。會後，我們安排一天的農場參訪，帶大家親見友善農耕的出路與未來。衷心希望，回到現實生活中，法鼓山的僧俗四眾、農業界的朋友、政府單位，及社會大眾，都能繼續以心靈環保為核心主軸，從自身做起，保護我們的山河大地。

 
佛教徒相信：人（和一切眾生）往生後會再投胎轉世，保護地球，不只是保護子孫的家園，因為，從佛教的輪迴觀點來看，我們大多數的人，都會再投生回來這個世界，因此保護子孫的家園，即是保護我們自己來世的家園。

有無蓋草的不同

 不施肥、不用酵素菌水，而覆蓋草幫助菜生長，卻容易引來蝸牛啃食的問題，因此今年以來，我很少覆蓋草。

 最近種了一畦芥菜苗後，用少量半腐的田草撒在上面，不敢舗太多，只因怕引來大非洲蝸牛躲在下面。

 兩周以後，看到這畦菜苗長大許多，而寄到蘿蔔畦那幾棵，（因為一畦種不完)，相對瘦小許多。

 可以清楚看出，稍微覆蓋半腐的草，對菜苗的幫助還是蠻大的！

這樣的破壞，環境會再復原嗎？
小小的台灣，良好的自然環境，到處受到破壞，台灣人怎麼會更健康、幸福呢？

醜柳丁

 昨天，樸耘生態教育園區的主人黃福君送了一小箱柳丁給我。它們的表皮黑黒的，不太好看，但是我就是喜歡自然、沒有經過人工美白的柳丁。

 高中時，吃了許多＂火燒丁＂，也就是這種醜黒柳丁，後來又偶而就有機會，吃到這種其貌不揚的柳丁。以我的經驗，它們幾乎都是柳丁味特別濃郁，特別地美味。

 今天試吃了這批柳丁，果然也是令人非常歡喜的風味：很濃、很自然、很甜也有酸味。
這是大家都應該重視、應該改變的，真的很重要！

環境雖好，茶卻不長

 10/28 ，我們一行人參訪南投竹山恆誠茶園時，茶二代年輕的主人，張顥嚴先生，帶我們看了一塊種植青心烏龍的園區。

 
主人告訴我們：＂這塊地的土質，越來越鬆軟肥沃，生態環境也越來越好，但是過去一次可以採收300斤，這三年來，卻一次最多只採到30斤，由於不敷成本，就不採收了。為什麼這麼好的園子，茶卻長不好呢？原來是青心烏龍喜歡冷涼，而天氣越來越熱，這個海拔(大約6、700公尺）它已經不能適應了，大概要在1200公尺高的山上，它才能長得好了。＂

 氣溫的變化，同樣也會影響稻麥、水果、蔬菜、雜糧等一切作物的生長。
不用任何容器，只用土塊育苗，真的很環保。不知台灣有沒有人已經在實行，很想了解。
他們用大量大家的錢毀壞自然生態、風景、水質和人的幸福！

text:
台灣許多美麗的山岳，都變成了墓園，死人跟活人爭地做什麼？

 死了以後還會馬上(或者慢一點)投胎當活人，還是照顧活人的生活要緊！

 台灣很小，真的要好好做環保，包括響應和推廣自然葬。但願環保自然葬區，如雨後春筍般出現，大墓園逐漸消退於無形。

年底再訪福和自然田園

 
十二月十九日，我們一行人（包括仕聰、哲敬、和長⋯等）到雲林二崙，參訪林振源先生，只有佔地六百坪的福和自然田園。這地方小小的，但可以有四、五分地的產能，相當驚人！

 這個農場已有七年沒有施肥了，只用落葉、雜草，和自己園內回收的資材，就把地養得太肥沃了，大家非常佩服。

 園中香蕉過剩，林先生把許多成熟或不成熟的果實，割下來餵養眾生或當肥料。白甘蔗超過一層樓高，很多都有網球粗，其他東西也都長得很壯。

 目前，已有八種作物不必種植，年年自己落種自己長，只要收成就可以了(有些必須移植)。

 一大欉粉䓤拔下後，大棵的用掉，小棵的留著，放一點水泡著，半個月後再種，還是可以長得很好，可見其生命力強韌！

 似乎所有的水果和蔬菜，都比去年還大些，果樹也長高長密了，作物一共有五十多種，置身其中，真有進入食物森林的感覺。

 林先生很樂意分享種植經驗，這個地方是我非常推薦農夫(或未來農夫)，以及關心農業生產的人，參訪、學習的地方。
